text:
looks like the links to the supported operators and expression tests are broken in the documentation at the top of the content in this page <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/if-statements>
<http://developers-web1-HubSpot.sites.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/operators-and-expression-tests?hsLang=en>

HubSpot devs, for the new Email drag and drop editor, what are the supported email clients? We have some people who need some old Outlook support, so before we start using it for them, we’d like to know what we’re getting into!
I feel like it’s similar to doing dev on any other page, you may have to write some logic to work around horrible Microsoft stuff.
The largest problems I’ve encountered with Outlook have stemmed from trying to put text on top of an image
And some `max-width:` issues
Other than that it’s usually not too bad
Fixed, thanks for pointing that out
I'm curious if you've got a process for editing DM2 modules via FTP.  Been trying to figure out local configuration for a while now.
Try Re copying the widget Snippet
It works if I use the widget snippet
but it doesn't work with the `custom_widget` call
We look to deploy that page as it is hence this approach
so that we don't have to customize it every time we deploy it
API AMA

Anyone out there know if there's a way past the following error?
```Error:12:0 table ****** does not exist in portal ******* ```
trying to demo a feature for a prospective client with a trial portal that doesn't have access to HUBDB
comment out all references to the HubDB?
Unfortunately, I need the HUBDB.  AJAX here I come!

I just figured that since all table data is publicly accessible, we could access tables from other portals.  I actually had a bug with this feature that meant it was pulling a table from another portal.  I'm seriously missing that bug right now

:point_right:*HUGE FRIDAY BREAKTHROUGH*:point_left:
We added new emoji's into this slack! :amazing:
> - Check out the custom emojis and have fun using them!
> - Comment/DM me with any other's you'd like to add
HAHAHA :jon-m:
:slightly_smiling_face: Thought you'd like that one

I'm thinking we include a "Custom Emoji Head" as a prize for CMS Developers who contribute 25+ items to the Code Gallery.
> - (code gallery is a new, open-source developer project launching in Q1)
contribute 50+ items and your emoji gets :will:  hair lol
hahahah YESSSS. Fo real, we can do that. (taking a note)
:chad:
:chad2:
For your serious conversations and your casual fridays
yep
ha
Example: :chad: is meeting with a new client but :chad2: is wearing plaid
i feel like i can connect with the plaid chad more
so personable
FYI ya’ll I thought Id announce it here.. After a long stretch with Bluleadz (and I love that company) I have decided to make the move after almost 9 years working with BZ and go solo.
congrats!
As of Next Friday I will no longer be an employee.
Wish me luck and send Jobs my way!
do you get to keep the plaid shirt?
tough crowd
:slightly_smiling_face:
Oh Yes, that one is mine.
phew
you will do fine, then
I feel like someone has kicked me from making any new emojis :smirk:
sowwwy
ha
Swapped to just Admin... to protect against potential abuse + so we can award them as prizes.
Thats ok Luke. I would’t have abused it… too much.
We'll keep the ones you added :wink:
:chad2:  is happy!
Slack only let's you do "Admin" or "All" .... can't do individual permissions
look its emoji inception
alright back to work…
if anyone wants a custom emoji (other than headshots, those will be awarded via Code Gallery) - DM me with them. I'm happy to add more.
-inbound next year - “we’ve been working to make HubSpot the most lovable collaborative platform for developers, -starting with emoji in the slack channel-” bunch of us dorks in the audience cheer
Next step. Slack bot responses…  :sharkdance:
HAHAHHA I am crying right now at these emojis
check out <https://mjml.io/>
I have that on my list to setup. :) I did welcome messages today tho.
Is there an “I’m blind” Emoji? — I can’t find figure out how to preview  the “B” variation on website pages outside the editor…
thought you went to the B version of the page in the editor and went to that preview link to see it
i want to be able to click a link to test the variation - but the preview in the editor doesnt allow that
i suppose one trick is to use the browser’s inspector to delete the overlay preventing the click
It depends on how you preview it.
You can use the setting sin the editor to preview the page different way as different people
OR if you want to be sneaky. you can use chromes setting to change country or device
bangarang
thanks to that idea, i found it!
sharable preview
question #2 — how do I create a field in my custom module that has these options for a link?
I tried a field type of “Page” but that only allows pages in HubSpot — no external pages
Welcome to the party <@UBRG1R3EW> that’s the most hotly requested field type for custom modules
You can fake this using conditional fields, a text field, some boolean fields and a page picker field
glad to be invited to the party!
resurfacing this question because I didn’t get a response and am wondering about it
We're targeting mid-November
